summary: The Gold King Mine Spill Compensation Act of 2025 aims to provide compensation to individuals, organizations, and companies harmed by the 2015 Gold King Mine wastewater spill. It defines key terms like "covered damages," "injured person," and "Gold King Mine spill." The Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) will investigate, consider, and determine compensation for eligible claimants who submitted claims before August 5, 2017. Compensation is limited to specific types of damages and excludes costs for response or emotional distress. The bill also establishes judicial review and requires the Administrator to report to Congress. It appropriates up to $3.3 million for claim payments.
